brief.content-text:
This animation depicts two types of switching methods of forwarding a frame, Fast-forward and Fragment-free.

Fast-forward
The switch is connected to three hosts and a server. One host sends a frame to another host via the switch. When the switch receives the packet, it thinks, I am receiving a frame. I will forward it immediately based on the destination MAC address.

Fragment-free
The switch is connected to three hosts and a server. One host sends a frame to another host via the switch. When the switch receives the packet, it thinks, I am receiving a frame. I will check the first 64 bytes of the frame to ensure this is a valid Ethernet frame. Once the switch completes the check, it thinks, This is a valid frame. I will forward it based on the destination MAC address.
